title: #1 Full Day Tour From Lima: Paracas and Huacachina Oasis
description: Discover the rich biodiversity of Peru’s landscapes on a day trip to the Ballestas Islands and the Huacachina sand dunes from Lima. Spot penguins, sea lions, and other species during a boat ride around what is hailed as Peru's answer to the Galapagos Islands, then satisfy an appetite for adventure in Huacachina during a dune buggy ride and sandboarding. Plus, you'll enjoy the flexibility to explore the desert town at your own pace during free time.
all_descriptions: Discover the rich biodiversity of Peru’s landscapes on a day trip to the Ballestas Islands and the Huacachina sand dunes from Lima. Spot penguins, sea lions, and other species during a boat ride around what is hailed as Peru's answer to the Galapagos Islands, then satisfy an appetite for adventure in Huacachina during a dune buggy ride and sandboarding. Plus, you'll enjoy the flexibility to explore the desert town at your own pace during free time.

ItineraryThis is a typical itinerary for this productStop At:Miraflores District, Lima PeruMeet the bus OPPOSITE the JW Marriott hotel, Malecon de la Reserva 615, Miraflores. Please wait near the small information kiosk. Make sure to be there by 5:45 am. The bus departs at 6:00 am.Duration: 4 hoursStop At:Islas Ballestas, Paracas 11660 PeruGo on the 2-hour boat tour of the islands, from 10:00 am to 12:00 pm. The Ballestas are a smaller version of the Galapagos and are just as great. You’ll see sea lions, penguins, and lots of birds all in their natural habitat. If you’re lucky, you may even see a dolphin or three!Duration: 2 hoursStop At:Huacachina, Huacachina, Ica RegionDepart from Paracas to Huacachina at 1:30 pm, arriving around 2:45 pm. 

You will have free time until the buggy and sandboarding tour starts.Duration: 2 hoursStop At:Huacachina Oasis, Unnamed Road, Huacachina 11000, PeruGo up the dunes on a buggy and sandboard down on this is a once-in-a-lifetime experience in the only natural desert oasis in South America.Duration: 1 hourStop At:Miraflores District, Lima PeruDeparts from Huacachina at 7:00 pm, arriving in Lima around 11:45 pm.

We will drop off passengers at the same place we pick up from, at approximately arrival 11:30 pm.Duration: 5 hours

JW Marriott Hotel Lima, Mal. de la Reserva 615, Miraflores Lima 18, PeruPassengers must be ready OPPOSITE the JW Marriott hotel, Mal. de la Reserva 615, Miraflores, from 05:45 am (wait near the small information kiosk). The bus departs here at 6:00 am.
End:This activity ends back at the meeting point.

reviews.title: Definitely an experience worth having.
reviews.text: Pick up in the morning was easy as we confirmed our hotel to be picked up at beforehand and the guides were in contact with us using WhatsApp. The guide was bilingual in Spanish and English and very engaging. Like all bus rides in Peru, it was very bumpy and quite a long ride. We had a coaster bus with a restroom for #1s only. We arrived at the boat launch to view penguins and sea lions (unfortunately we only saw 1 penguin, however there were a lot of sea lions, which was fine as wild animals don’t do appearances on queue). The boat ride is choppy so if you get sea sick take your tablets before getting on the boat. I would also advise bringing your rain jacket as some persons on our tour got pretty drenched from the water spray coming back to land. After the boat tour, Lunch was arranged while on the bus so it was ready as we arrived at the restaurant. The food wasn’t anything lavish but it was still very good with one protein meal and chicha/lemonade/water. Initially arriving at the oasis we only had a short time to grab snacks/water/facemasks and select our dinners (to be collected after) before meeting up to go on the dune buggies. We signed up for the addition hour to not feel rushed. The ride through the dunes was exciting with some thrilling steep hills. We stopped for sand boarding (3 hills that got gradually smaller and being required to carry your body boards to the next hill). We also stopped for 2 photo opps, one on top of the dunes and one later for the sunset photo. After the sunset photo we came back to the start point, had about 45-1hr of free time and to pick up/eat the pre-ordered dinners. After this it was a long bus ride back where the lights were turned off and being tired from a full day you can probably fall asleep. As a side note, all bus rides taken in Lima/Cusco are bumpy and sway back and forth pretty much the entire way - if you get car sick definitely take this into consideration.

reviews.title: Well organized full day trip
reviews.text: One of the best organised day tours I've been to. Luz explained every step of the tour clearly and precisely, repeating everything in the dedicated WhatsApp group.Separately paid extras were also clearly summarised including prices in dollars and soles.We enjoyed all activities and would recommend this company.

reviews.title: Scenic Pacific Coast Tour and Desert Extravaganza.
reviews.text: From start to end the day was perfect. Everything was very organized and easy to follow. Luz was fantastic, so kind, knowledgeable, and helpful. The day included a two hour boat, seeing animal sanctuary with seals, sea lions, and penguins. Went to a gorgeous winery for a fab meal, big portions for a reasonable price. Finally, the best part, dune bugging and sand boarding (on your stomach) in the desert. I got the 1 hour trip, because i was afraid of motion sickness (i got a little woozy on the boat), but the bugging and sliding were so fun, felt so safe, the perfect dateline rush! Fantastic day!!

reviews.title: The dunes were amazing!
reviews.text: Overall a very enjoyable trip!  Huachachina was my favourite part.  The dune buggies and sand boarding were very fun and I enjoyed them more than I expected to.  I also enjoyed tasting the different piscos.  The islands were impressive and very pretty but because of the time of year there wasn't a huge amount of animals on them.  The boat driver will turn around to show everyone the views but I think generally you get better views on the left hand side of the boat than the right.  The tour was run by Sol and Mar who were very friendly, informative and kept everything running smoothly!

reviews.title: The best of the best
reviews.text: If I would come back to Perù I would choose this tour again with my closed eyes. A big thanks to Mar and Sol for being the guides that everyone wants. They created the best atmosphere for everyone even for me that i was travelling solo. Be ready to see amazing locations with penguins, sea lions and much more. Thanks to Miky to be so funny and loved his music taste on the boat! Thanks also to the star of the day Gonzalo, our buggy driver, he made our day. Pure adrenaline.The best tour ever with the best people.

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.text: The Guides Mar and Dol were amazing. The trip went beyond my expectations. I did the 2 hr and buggies and sandoarding experience and it was the perfect ampunt of time.

reviews.title: Crazy!
reviews.text: Lovely experience in both Islas Ballestas and Huacachina with the dune buggy. Mar and Sol have been very great and sunny persons.

reviews.title: Truly an escape from Lima!
reviews.text: This tour went above and beyond my expectations! Boat tour/Dune buggy ride were great and both Sol and Mar (tour guides) kept things flowing smoothly overall. Would definitely do this tour again. Just be prepared for a long day- but it was worth it!

reviews.title: If you’re wondering about the sand buggy - do it.
reviews.text: My (unexpected) favourite part of the day was the sand buggy! It was great seeing lots of sea lions and birds at Paracas and our guide for the islands, Mickey, was very funny with lots of singing and  dancing between facts. The pisco sour tasting was really interesting. Again, a nice level of interactive and fun. Our main guides Marjorie and Sol were very helpful, always available and friendly. Overall, a really good experience.

reviews.title: Huacachita and paracas tour review
reviews.text: Worth every penny, sol and mar were amazing aswell. Highly recommend!The trip lasts about 17 hours and you get to know amazing places, see penguins eat great food (not included) and experience the huacachina.
